docs.text: linda fiorentino disappeared off the radar after a deservedly heralded turn in the cable pic the last seduction , and her being cast as dogma's lead is nothing short of inexplicable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she's still in fine form as bethany , an abortion clinic worker who's lost her faith .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one night , a visitor from heaven makes a fiery entrance in bethany's bedroom .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is metatron ( alan rickman ) , the voice of god , and he needs her help : she must stop two fallen angels from entering a new jersey church-the fate of the universe depends on it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: god would do it him/herself , but he/she is . . . missing , having taken up human form somewhere on earth never to be heard from again .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: bethany is joined on her road trip to the garden state by the " prophets " jay ( jason mewes ) and silent bob ( kevin smith , doing double-duty ) , the slacker minstrels who have appeared in all of smith's films thus far .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at some point , rock drops naked out of the sky as rufus , the undocumented ( and very black ) " thirteenth apostle " , and offers his assistance , as does divine stripper serendipity ( salma hayek ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a wild ride .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they're in pursuit of loki and bartleby ( damon and affleck , respectively-this is probably the sharpest either has ever been ) , who were banished from heaven to wisconsin and have discovered a dogmatic loophole that will enable their return .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: loki decides to wreak havoc along the way with the knowledge that his sins will be absolved at the pearly gates .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at one point , he terrorizes a boardroom full of suits with an angry combination of words and bullets .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a nasty , guiltily enjoyable little scene that asks , " how corrupt are you ? " .

docs.text: wings of desire this ain't .

docs.text: since debuting with clerks , smith has grown as a director , particularly in terms of working with actors .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( chris rock is this film's only weak link-between jokes , he's wooden . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his no-frills visual style hasn't changed much over the years , though ( dogma's widescreen compositions at least have blockbuster affectations ) , nor has his writing-his characters still sit around delivering one caustic , hilarious speech after another .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: dogma chips away at big religious issues-namely , the hypocrisy that accompanies any organized system of beliefs-eloquently and articulately , but a few of the monologues sound too much like blatant exposition .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as well , the verbal introduction of each new person seems to take forever .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: any movie with this much weighty talk would have a hard time maintaining momentum ( hurlyburly , anyone ? ) , and eventually dogma's pacing goes slack .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a long diatribe from bartleby late in the game , in which he laments the destiny of celestial beings , comes at a point when we've heard enough .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: because his change of heart ( bartleby is initially the good cop to loki's bad ) drives the climax , said rant is given a great deal of screen time .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sure , affleck deserved a big moment ( damon steals their scenes together prior ) , but it ultimately makes the film and us feel bloated .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: like tarantino , smith was a video-age sponge who became a sample-mad indie filmmaker .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: dogma pays welcome homage to an eclectic batch of movies , including indiana jones and the last crusade , with silent bob doing his best harrison ford , and weird science-a shit demon attacks our heroes !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: smith also has a kitchen sink brand of humour : his dexterous maneuvering between the satirical ( a cardinal played by george carlin attempts to mount a publicity campaign with the slogan " catholicism wow ! " ) and the scatalogical ensures that no lover of comedy will leave dogma feeling malnourished .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i bust ( ed ? ) a gut on several occasions .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: proceedings also get off on the right foot with the opening with the funniest disclaimer ever .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a disclaimer unlikely to put protestors at ease , for to read it , one actually has to see dogma .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the prerelease ballyhoo is in the tradition of the last temptation of christ's , martin scorsese's 1988 adaptation of nikos kazantzakis' controversial novel , in that it is not directly linked to the picture's content but to rumours and heresy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there's a famous anecdote about fletch director michael ritchie inviting picketers of the last temptation of christ into a screening on his dime , just so they could know for certain what they were rallying against .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( not one of them had watched it . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: every single person refused .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: smith and scorsese have a lot in common , and so do the two films in question , because both smith's bethany and scorsese's jesus are hollow shells without their faith .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in fact , dogma's denouement ( which follows a thrilling showdown that's worth the wait ) is a catholic love-in , a veritable recruitment poster .

docs.text: ( i felt sentimental about a religion i don't belong to .

docs.text: now that's powerful filmmaking . ) smith is nothing if not sincere about his own devotion to god , and that spirituality shines through .

docs.text: it's enough to make me forgive dogma for its editorial sins .

docs.text: my religion is movies .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when the catholic league beats on dogma for imaginary crimes against a doctrine , in a roundabout way they're attacking what i live for : freedom of expression through celluloid .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i therefore feel that , although i'm no bible-thumper , i'm at least as qualified to criticize dogma as william donohue and his followers .
